abstract: Norwegian grandmaster Magnus Carlsen defeats Sergey Karjakin of Russia to claim World Chess Championship title; tournament, played at Fulton Market Building in Lower Manhattan, offered 12 games played over nearly three-week period, with final day of high-speed tiebreakers.
lead_paragraph: On his 26th birthday, Mr. Carlsen beat Sergey Karjakin in a series of high-speed tiebreakers, securing his reputation as a player with no weaknesses.
snippet: On his 26th birthday, Mr. Carlsen beat Sergey Karjakin in a series of high-speed tiebreakers, securing his reputation as a player with no weaknesses....

headline.main: Magnus Carlsen Overwhelms Challenger in Tiebreakers to Win World Chess Championship
headline.print_headline: Carlsen, ‘Mozart of Chess,’ Overwhelms Challenger to Win Championship
